009package ImageAccessorDemos;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.image.access.ImageAccessor;
016import imagingbook.common.image.access.ScalarAccessor;
017import imagingbook.common.image.access.VectorAccessor;
018import imagingbook.core.plugin.JavaDocHelp;
019
020/**
021 * This plugin demonstrates the of class {@link ImageAccessor} for
022 * unified access to scalar and vector-valued images.
023 * The plugin adds 20 brightness units to each component (color
024 * plane) of the active image. It can be applied to any image type.
025 * Image pixels are treated as vectors, even if only a single
026 * component is present.
027 * TODO: move to other package
028 * 
029 * @author WB
030 *
031 * @see ImageAccessor
032 * @see ScalarAccessor
033 * @see VectorAccessor
034 */
035public class ImageAccessor_Demo_Vector implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
036
037        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus img) {
038                return DOES_ALL;
039        }
040
041        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
042                final int width = ip.getWidth();
043                final int height = ip.getHeight();
044                
045                ImageAccessor ia = ImageAccessor.create(ip, null, null);
046                IJ.log(ia.toString());
047                
048                for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
049                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
050                                float[] vals = ia.getPix(u, v);         // get a single pixel (vector)
051                                for (int i = 0; i < vals.length; i++) {
052                                        vals[i] += 20;
053                                }
054                                ia.setPix(u, v, vals);
055                        }
056                }
057        }
058
059}
